newsitem.title: DUBAI: Arab state's 1995 GDP up 5.9 percent -report.
newsitem.headline: Arab state's 1995 GDP up 5.9 percent -report.

text.p: The Arab world's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) climbed by 5.9 percent to $528.7 billion in 1995, a report carried by the official WAM news agency said.

The report issued by four organisations -- the Arab Fund for Economic and Social Development, the Arab Monetary Fund and the Organisation of Arab Petroleum Exporting Countries -- said the rise was due to stronger oil prices and economic reforms.
It said Arab states cut their total deficit by one-third in 1995 to $21.4 billion.
